description.narrative: The project's aim is to reduce female genital mutilation/cutting (FGM/C) through enhanced public policy and alternative livelihoods opportunities for women and girls, changing community perception on FGM/C and improving reporting, prevention of FGM/C as we ll as improving the care of FGM/C victims. FGM/C is nearly universal in Somalia with 98% of women reporting to have experienced such practice. 46 % of girls between the ages of 0 to 14 years have experienced FGM/C as reported by their mothers. According to the Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey (MICS) 2006, the highest FGM prevalence is among women aged 15-49 is in South Central at 99.2%, Somaliland at 94.4% and Puntland at 98.1%.The Somali have a close cultural value around virginity and marriageability. Ty pe III FGM (infibulation) is performed to ensure sexual purity and chastity. The project will raise awareness and create correct understading amongt community members, elders and leader on FGM/C through workshops and campaigns. Case reporting is strengthen ed by establihing a hotline and training police on the management of FGM/C cases. Working with the Ministry for Justice on frameworks and policies on punishing and prohibiting FGM practices as well as supporting the recovery of victims of FGM through thera py. The project directly benefits approximately 5000 people. The project is implemented by World Vision Somalia.
